history.content: I did EP after my freshman year. I've heard the acceptances are somewhat rolling so apply as early as possible if you're going to. I don't have experience applying twice but I would apply now, it's a great program and the reason I'm still a CS major.

children.subject:
Did EP after freshman year.  Google does prioritize sophomores so your chances are a little lower as a freshman (so don't get discouraged if things don't work out!), but there's no harm in trying. At minimum, it's good interview practice.

Companies do keep a file on you, but most companies (at least the good ones) know that you're learning and growing as a college student and they won't hold it against you if you do poorly in an internship interview. If anything, I've heard from recruiters that they become more likely to hire you in the future because you've shown consistent interest in the company, and will hopefully be demonstrating growth in your skills/resume/interview performance.

(Source:  junior who's received offers from Apple, Google, Microsoft, and Facebook - with some of those offers only coming after trying for several years)

history.content:
Hi everyone! Has anyone here applied to or landed an internship through Google's STEP program (formerly Engineering Practicum)? I'm planning to apply this year (I'm a first-year with some/decent coding experience) but I've been told that they keep files on you and if you get rejected one year, you'll have less chance of getting accepted the following year(s). Is this true? I was thinking I could apply again next year since they take both freshmen and sophomores, but is it worth the risk this year? Should I only apply next year?

Any advice would be greatly appreciated! I'd love to hear your thoughts on this. Thanks so much and go bears!
history.subject: Applying to Google STEP?
